# Contributing to Testergizer Open-Core

Thank you for your interest in contributing!

This project follows an open-core model and welcomes community involvement
through issues, discussions, and pull requests.

## How to Contribute

### 1. Fork the repository
Click “Fork” at the top-right of the page and clone your fork.

### 2. Create a feature branch
```
git checkout -b feature/my-improvement
```

### 3. Commit your changes using clear messages
```
git commit -m "Add improved locator scoring algorithm"
```

### 4. Push and open a Pull Request
Link the PR to an issue where possible.

## Coding Standards

- TypeScript preferred  
- Follow ESLint rules  
- Include tests when appropriate  
- Keep modules small and focused  
- Maintain compatibility with Playwright  

## Pull Request Requirements

- Clear description of purpose  
- Tests included (if applicable)  
- No breaking changes unless discussed  
- Documentation updated  

## Code of Conduct

Please maintain a respectful and collaborative tone.  
Harassment or abuse is not tolerated.

## License

By contributing, you agree your work is licensed under Apache-2.0.
